recipes.title: Maple Mustard Glazed Grilled Salmon

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir are great choices for Fish. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. The Tiamo Pinot Grigio with a 4.2 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 8 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Tiamo Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: Light straw yellow color. Fresh and rich fruity aromas of apple and pear with a hint of citrus fruit that fade into the floral bouquet. Fresh and fruity, very clean and crisp.Tiamo Pinot Grigio pairs well with a wide array of lighter cuisine, especially fish/shellfish, poultry, pastas in cream sauce and softer cheeses. It's also an ideal aperitif.

recipes.instructions: Brush grill with olive oil and set to medium heat.In a small bowl, add maple syrup, mustard, thyme and pepper; mix well; set a side.Sprinkle both the sides of the salmon with ground pepper (just a light dusting).Place salmon on the grill. If salmon has skin, cook with skin side up for 1 minutes, just to get grill marks on salmon. Then flip salmon and cook for about 5 - 7 minutes, until the flesh starts to flake easily when tested with a fork or until desired degree of doneness.Brush the salmon with maple glaze and serve immediately.

steps.step: Brush grill with olive oil and set to medium heat.In a small bowl, add maple syrup, mustard, thyme and pepper; mix well; set a side.Sprinkle both the sides of the salmon with ground pepper (just a light dusting).

Place salmon on the grill. If salmon has skin, cook with skin side up for 1 minutes, just to get grill marks on salmon. Then flip salmon and cook for about 5 - 7 minutes, until the flesh starts to flake easily when tested with a fork or until desired degree of doneness.
Brush the salmon with maple glaze and serve immediately.
